Voice Commands

Navigate and interact using your voice

  • “Go home”Navigate to home page
  • “Go to dashboard”Open your profile dashboard
  • “Next card / Previous card”Navigate between word cards
  • “Explain this word”Get word definition and examples
  • “Read this word”Hear the pronunciation
  • “Save this word”Mark word as learned
  • “Scroll down / Scroll up”Navigate the page
  • “Close”Close current modal
  • “Toggle theme”Switch between light and dark mode

Note: Voice commands work best in Chrome and Edge browsers

EXPLORE

Explore Words

Click on any card to view details, pronunciation, and examples

Ephemeral

Advanced

Lasting for a very short time; transitory.

“The ephemeral beauty of cherry blossoms reminds us to appreciate fleeting moments.”

Resilience

Intermediate

The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.

“The community showed remarkable resilience after the natural disaster.”

Eclectic

Intermediate

Deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources.

“Her eclectic music collection spans from classical to hip-hop.”

Tenacity

Intermediate

The quality of being persistent or determined; holding firmly to something.

“His tenacity in pursuing the case finally led to justice being served.”

Ambivalent

Intermediate

Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something.

“She felt ambivalent about accepting the job offer in another city.”

Pragmatic

Intermediate

Dealing with things sensibly and realistically based on practical considerations.

“She took a pragmatic approach to solving the budget crisis.”

Mellifluous

Advanced

(of a voice or words) sweet or musical; pleasant to hear.

“Her mellifluous voice captivated the audience from the first note.”

Serendipity

Intermediate

The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.

“Finding that rare book at the garage sale was pure serendipity.”

Ubiquitous

Advanced

Present, appearing, or found everywhere.

“Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.”

Meticulous

Intermediate

Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.

“The detective was meticulous in gathering evidence for the case.”

Eloquent

Intermediate

Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.

“The lawyer delivered an eloquent closing argument that swayed the jury.”

Ineffable

Advanced

Too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.

“The view from the mountaintop was ineffable; words cannot do it justice.”
